file_content.text: Gravity Hook Seven secure. Hutt suspicion level: three-point-two percent and plummeting.
The Third Eye has crashed. The Hutts will never find us now.
Destruction confirmed. Probe scans show fire, organic body components, zero survivors--a stellar tragedy.
The Hutts now run blind. Imperial operations on Gravity Hook Seven remain hidden. Chance of detection reduced to zero-point-three percent.
With our base secure, we can concentrate on recovering the stores of isotope-5.
Back to the real mission.
I will inform Katha Niar of your progress.
I thought we erased any chance the Hutts had of finding our base.
They may still detect us?
Minimal risks remain. None worthy of your attention.
Lower our detection chance to zero. Fail me, and you fail the Emperor.
Not good enough.
Recalibrating scans. Doubling probe patrols. I will not disappoint.
Transfer my credits before those percentages start to creep back up.
My payment. Now.
Right away, hunter.
If our risk of exposure rises so much as one percent, I'll melt you into slag.
Keep it that way, or else.
Maintain our deception. One slip up, and I'll personally wipe your memory banks.
Keep it that way, or else.
Noted. I will continue to operate at peak efficiency.
Your mission is clear to proceed. Seize the isotope-5 for the Empire. Leave the Hutt spies to me.
The Third Eye approaches. Steal access codes, hijack shuttle, intercept the Hutt vessel.
Commander. Your covert expertise is needed. Your allies, too, of course.
My lord, I observed your crushing defeat of Commander J'Ruush. Efficient. Brutal. Impressive.
Hunter. Rousing execution of Commander J'Ruush. Thankfully, I am not programmed to feel jealousy.
Cleaning up after your operation, Commander. Spy satellites distracted. Witnesses eliminated.
GR-18, at your service. Teamwork raises lethality sixty percent--a low estimation, given your recent assault.
As expected, the Hutts remain ignorant of the Empire's presence. But our concealment is in jeopardy.
I have detected a threat. Chance of compromising isotope-5 recovery: twenty percent... technically within tolerance levels.
Even the smallest dangers must be rooted out and destroyed. The Empire's survival demands it.
We tolerate no threats.
Agreed. Zero tolerance. Extreme responses.
You're far too tolerant. Even minimal threats must be smothered before they rage out of control.
Unacceptable.
I see. Smothered. A sound conviction.
Sounds like there's a one-hundred-percent chance you need me to take this problem down.
Another threat, another job.
Correct. Katha Niar has arranged additional payment.
The fate of the Empire hangs on our recovery of isotope-5. Even a one-percent chance of failure is unacceptable.
We can't afford the risk.
Noted. Updating threat assessment.
I need the full report. Threat ID, risk assessment, everything you have.
Give me the details.
Did the Cartel send a team to check in? Or is the Republic paying us a visit?
What is this threat?
The Emperor's Wrath doesn't strike at phantom dangers.
A waste of time.
This danger is real and imminent. Worthy of the Wrath's attention.
Do you actually think such trivial risks concern a member of the Dark Council?
You dare waste my time?
No insult intended. This threat is anything but trivial.
You've got a job, spit it out. Guesswork and percentages just slow me down.
Cut to the chase.
Deploy probes and inform Katha Niar. Your threat is not my priority.
This isn't my responsibility.
I alerted my master. She ordered me to brief you.
A Hutt vessel approaches. Dubbed the "Third Eye." High-resolution optics, signal monitors--a roving spy cruiser. Manned by the Hutt Cartel's top observers and assassins.
If the Third Eye detects us, mission failure probability rises to one hundred percent.
That ship is a threat. We need to end it. Recommendations?
It's up to us to stop them.
Calculating plan of attack.
When will the Hutt ship discover that the Empire's on Makeb?
How long until they detect us?
One hour. Less, if they increase engine power.
My focus lies with isotope-5. End the Third Eye's threat, or Cartel spies will be the least of your worries.
Deal with this ship at once.
Imperial forces lack your ability. Only you can down the vessel.
What are you waiting for? Blast the Hutt vessel out of the sky and be done with it.
Shoot down the ship already.
Excellent proposal--sadly impossible. Overt attacks will alert the Hutts to our presence.
Recommended solution: Board the Third Eye, exterminate crew, upload virus to trigger crash. Impact and fuel combustion will incinerate surviving witnesses.
I'll ride the Third Eye's burning wreckage to its doom.
The Hutts' ship will fall.
Excellent. Lightsaber carnage is encouraged. Trick the Hutts into blaming the crash on Jedi.
I look forward to plucking out the Hutt Cartel's prying eye.
The Third Eye will soon fall.
Excellent. Use of Force lightning is encouraged. Electrical fires spark four percent of all airborne crashes.
Look to the sky. When the Hutt ship goes down, begin transferring my payment.
It's a deal.
Funds unfrozen and awaiting mission completion.
Stay alert and maintain cover. We'll neutralize the Third Eye.
We're on it.
I will monitor your operation and update Katha Niar.
Access the Third Eye via Regulator mercenary shuttle. Steal access codes and shuttle from local mercenary camp.
Infiltrating a moving cruiser won't be simple.
How do we board the ship?
Once on board, I will monitor and update. Fail, and risk the Empire's demise.
That's awful. [Refuse quest]
Grids one through nine on alert. Scanning for Hutt satellites.
